Dummy bills are zero-value, do not assess product charges and neither contribute towards nor benefit from discounts. This allows archiving and deleting of events on those accounts without the operational or performance overhead of producing a true bill.

dim_billing_account.description:
Contains parameters of Billing Accounts, which can be Postpaid or Prepaid depending on their billing method. The Billing Account is the entity that is invoiced. Bills are produced on an account-by-account basis. A single customer can have multiple accounts, providing the potential for great flexibility in the range of products taken by each customer (including charging in multiple currencies, mixing prepaid and postpaid, tax inclusive and tax exclusive, and so on).
Billing Account object type contains common account parameters, which are applicable for both Prepaid and Postpaid ones.

Billing Account object type contains common account parameters, which are applicable for both Prepaid and Postpaid ones.

dim_eventdiscount.description: All event discounts can be described as a percentage or monetary amount off a subset of all events.

fields.description: Event discount ID.
fields.name: event_discount_id

fields.description: Identifies a related set of changes to the catalog (product, price plans, packages) that may be applied to the live price plan.
fields.name: catalogue_change_id

fields.description: The name of the discount.
fields.name: discount_value

fields.description: Description.
fields.name: discount_desc

fields.description: Defines the attribute to be summed and compared with EventDiscountStep.threshold. Note: with respect to a rating time discount, the fixed charge portion of an event's cost will only ever be discounted if this attribute specifies 'cost' or 'number of events' (even in cases where the discount is flat-rate, that is, only one EventDiscountStep with threshold zero).
fields.name: summation_attr_num_id

fields.description: Defines the possible values of the summation attributes for an event discount. Based on the number of attributes in CostedEvent.
fields.name: summation_attr_num_value

fields.description: Identifies whether stepped discounts are applied to the items which fall within each pair of thresholds (for example, first $10 of calls free is marginal discount), or that discounts are applied to all events, based on the highest threshold reached (for example, 10% off all calls if you spend more than $20).
fields.name: marginal_discount_boo

fields.description: The identifier of the bonus scheme to which this EventDiscount relates. This defines the account specific threshold to be used when calculating a 'free event' discount. Thresholds in EventDiscountStep are therefore ignored.
fields.name: bonus_scheme_id

fields.description: If set to T, this event discount only applies to periodic bills. This is to prevent too many free events being given away for discounts of the form 'First 15 minutes of calls free'.
fields.name: periodic_only_boo

fields.description: The identifier of the revenue code against which the discount should be registered. It may only be null for a non-accumulating flat amount discount.
fields.name: revenue_code_id

fields.description: Level at which events are aggregated in the assessment set for threshold based discounts.
fields.name: assessment_aggregation_level_id

fields.description: Level at which events are aggregated in the assessment set for threshold based discounts.
fields.name: assessment_aggregation_level_value

fields.description: Level at which events are aggregated in the discounted set to receive threshold based discounts.
fields.name: discounting_aggregation_level_id

fields.description: Level at which events are aggregated in the discounted set to receive threshold based discounts.
fields.name: discounting_aggregation_level_value

fields.description: The event type associated with the assessment set. Note that an entry of null and the absence of an entry in bonus_scheme_id implies the discount is assessed on all event types. If there is an entry in bonus_scheme_id, assessment is done in the processing of UsageTypes.
fields.name: assessment_event_type_id

fields.description: The event type associated with the discounting set. Note that an entry of null implies the discount is made on all event types.
fields.name: discounting_event_type_id

fields.description: The filter used to calculate the assessment set. Note that an entry of null and the absence of an entry in bonus_scheme_id implies the discount is assessed on all events of the type listed in assessment_event_type_id. If there is an entry in bonus_scheme_id, assessment is done in the processing of UsageTypes.
fields.name: assessment_filter_id

fields.description: The filter used to calculate the discounting set. Note that an entry of null implies the discount is made on all events of the type listed in discounting_event_type_id.
fields.name: discounting_filter_id

fields.description: States whether a discount can be prorated in part periods. Discounts belonging to bonus schemes (having an entry in bonus_scheme_id) should automatically be non prorating.
fields.name: pro_rating_boo

fields.description:
Contains the numeric value of the discount period. Will be null if the discount is a flat rate or part of a bonus scheme (possesses a bonus_scheme_id).
For periodic rating time discounts, this defines the interval from the CustProductDiscountUsage's start date to the CustProductDiscountUsage's end date.
When allocate_full_periods_boo is set to 'T', this specifies the validity period of each discount period.
fields.name: discount_period

fields.description: Contains the unit of the discount period. Will be null if the discount is a flat rate discount (for example, 15% off all events indefinitely) or the discount is part of a bonus scheme (possesses a bonus_scheme_id).
fields.name: discount_period_units_id

fields.description: Indicates whether a discount is parametric. Selecting a discount to be parametric only has a non-trivial effect if the discount involves parametric products. In that case, the values of the thresholds are multiplied by the quantity of the parametric product. Any absolute amounts in such a discount are also multiplied by the quantity of the parametric product.
fields.name: parametric_boo

fields.description: The name of the units being entered to measure the volume usage in an aggregate pricing.
fields.name: aggregation_unit_value

fields.description: The multiplier that relates the aggregation units to one of the standard system units.
fields.name: aggregation_rate_multiplier

fields.description: The system units that are related to the aggregation units measuring volume in an aggregate pricing.
fields.name: aggregation_rate_units

fields.description: Value only relevant for "Free/Discounted Usage" discounts in rating, should be null for other types of discount. If set to T, the discount period cycle synchronizes with the nominal bill date. If set to F, the discount period cycle continues independently of the nominal bill date.
fields.name: synchronise_boo

fields.description: Value only relevant for "Free/Discounted Usage" discounts in rating, should be null for other types of discount. If set to T, the discount will allow carrying over of free/discounted usage into the next discount period.
fields.name: rating_carry_over_boo

fields.description: Value only relevant for "Free/Discounted Usage" discounts in rating, where rating_carry_over_boo is set to T, should be null for other types of discount. Gives the maximum amount of discounted usage carried over from one period to the next.
fields.name: max_carry_over_num

fields.description: Replaces re_rating_boo. Dictates the type of discount the EventDiscount record describes.
fields.name: discount_type_id

fields.description:
Optional attribute that sets a priority for "Free/Discounted Usage" discounts, for use if more than one "Free/Discounted Usage" discount applies to an event. Null if the discount is not a "Free Usage" or "Discounted Usage" discount.
If the discount is a usage counter, then this field will have -1 or -2. -1 indicates the usage counter accumulates pre-discounted usage; -2 indicates the usage counter accumulates discounted usage
This attribute can also be set optionally to billing time post-itemisation discounts applicable to event charges. The valid values are from 1 to 99.
fields.name: priority_num

fields.description: Gives the filter set applicable to the discoun.
fields.name: filter_set_id

fields.description: Gives the filter set applicable to the discoun.
fields.name: filter_set_value

fields.description: The identifier of the rating time discount bundle level action threshold set that should be applied to this rating time discount.
fields.name: disc_act_thold_set_id

fields.description: Specifies whether an event qualifies for a rating discount as defined by its event_dtm or created_dtm. It is null for all discount types other than rating time discounts.
fields.name: rating_assessment_criteria_id

fields.description: Specifies whether an event qualifies for a rating discount as defined by its event_dtm or created_dtm. It is null for all discount types other than rating time discounts.
fields.name: rating_assessment_criteria_value

fields.description: Determines whether the Active Rating Engine assesses events received after a created_dtm assessment mode discount has been terminated using the event_dtm instead of the created_dtm. It is null for all discount types other than rating time discounts.
fields.name: include_post_term_boo

fields.description: Specifies whether the CustProdInvoiceDiscUsage records should be maintained for a flat rate rating time discount. This is null for any billing time discounts.
fields.name: rating_accumulate_boo

fields.description: Only meaningful for post-itemization discounts . If set to T, then the discount amount is apportioned over all charges eligible for receiving discount, irrespective of the taxation model. In case of US taxation, if this field is set to "T", then the discounted charge amounts are presented to the tax library.
fields.name: disc_distribution_boo

fields.description: Specifies whether any discount amount defined on the discount step is applied once for the discount period (F), or once per discount amount unit (T). If this attribute is F, then discount_sum_attr_num, discount_sum_multiplier and discount_sum_name must be null. This must only be T for rating type discounts.
fields.name: amount_per_unit_boo

fields.description: Specifies the attribute of the discount set of events whose value is used to multiply (divided by the multiplier) the discount amount to calculate the total discount amount. If this attribute is populated then discount_sum_multiplier must be populated and amount_per_unit_boo must be T.
fields.name: discount_summation_attr_num_id

fields.description: Defines the possible values of the summation attributes for an event discount. Based on the number of attributes in CostedEvent.
fields.name: discount_summation_attr_num_value

fields.description: Specifies a number that is used to divide the value of the discount_sumn_attr_num of the discount event(s) before it is multiplied by the discount amount to calculate the total discount amount. If this attribute is populated then discount_sum_attr_num must be populated and amount_per_unit_boo must be T.
fields.name: discount_sum_multiplier

fields.description: This name will be output to BillData along with the discount set. This must be null if amount_per_unit_boo is F.
fields.name: discount_sum_value

fields.description: If a discount period is specified, then this value specifies the maximum amount of money that will be discounted per discount period. It must be null if rating_accumulate_boo is 'F'. For flat-rate discounts, the maximum applies to the entire life of the discount
fields.name: period_maximum_mny

fields.description: T' if the CustProdInvoiceDiscUsage.counter_usage should be reset when the accumulated usage in a usage counter crosses a threshold.
fields.name: reset_counter_boo

fields.description: Only applicable to accumulating rating time discounts. If set to 'T', the total usage that has passed the discount's filter in the current discount period/invoice will be recorded in CustProdInvoiceDiscUsage.total_usage. If set to 'F', the qualifying usage will not be recorded. Should be null for all other types of discount.
fields.name: store_qualifying_usage_boo

fields.description: Only relevant for free usage or discounted usage rating time discounts. When set to 'T', the discount period (i.e., CustProductDiscountUsage) can last beyond the associated discount instance's (i.e., CustProdRatingDiscount's) life. Such CustProductDiscountUsage last for a full discount period.
fields.name: apply_until_expired_boo

fields.description: Only relevant for rating time discounts. When set to 'T', the full discount period will always be allocated. When used in conjunction with synchronise_boo, the discount period will not be truncated to match the end of the billing period. This can result in overlapping dates of the discount buckets. When set to 'F', discount bucket dates will be sequential.
fields.name: allocate_full_periods_boo

fields.description: Only relevant for rating time discounts. Contains the numeric value of the allocation period of discount, which should be less than or equal to the discount period. Determines the period between the start dates of consecutive discount periods.
fields.name: allocation_period

fields.description: Only relevant for rating time discounts. Valid only when allocation_period is not null. Contains the unit of the allocation_period.
fields.name: allocation_period_units_id

fields.description: Contains the unit of the allocation_period.
fields.name: allocation_period_units_value

fields.description: Indicates if a permanent override of the threshold amount is allowed (assuming user has proper permissions).
fields.name: perm_override_enable_rule_id

fields.description: Indicates if a permanent override of the threshold amount is allowed (assuming user has proper permissions).
fields.name: perm_override_enable_rule_value

fields.description:
Indicates if a temporary (current-period only) override of the threshold amount is allowed
(assuming user has proper permissions).
fields.name: temp_override_enable_rule_id

fields.description:
Indicates if a temporary (current-period only) override of the threshold amount is allowed
(assuming user has proper permissions).
fields.name: temp_override_enable_rule_value

fields.description: Indicates the number of CustProductDiscountUsage records that can be re-used cyclically. If null, CustProductDiscountUsage/CustProdInvoiceDiscUsage will not be re-used. This should have a minimum value of 2.
fields.name: keep_periods

fields.description: An optional initial bonus awarded for this Discounted Usage Discount. This is only relevant for periodic Discounted Usage Discounts (discount_type = 1 and discount_period is not null).
fields.name: initial_bonus_award

fields.description: Identifies the reason code used for any initial bonus awarded on this Discounted Usage Discount. This cannot be null if initial_bonus_award is not null.
fields.name: initial_bonus_reason_id

fields.description: An optional initial value for the discount counter usage. If null, the initial counter usage will be set to zero. This is only relevant for discounts of discount_type = 7 (Usage Counter).
fields.name: initial_counter_usage

fields.description:
Indicates the prioritization of CustProductDiscountUsage records during per discount consumption. This should have value of 1, 2 or 3.
1. indicates the earliest discount bucket is used first followed by the next earliest discount in ascending date order.
2 indicates latest discount bucket to be used first followed by the next discount in descending date order.
3 indicates latest discount bucket to be consumed first, followed by the earliest discount buckets in ascending date order.
fields.name: period_priority_strategy_id

fields.description: Indicates the prioritization of CustProductDiscountUsage records during per discount consumption.
fields.name: period_priority_strategy_value

fields.description:
Enables recharge of non-monetary rating time discounts, or charging only a proportion of the discountable usage for cost-based rating time discounts.
Must be populated for an event discount specified by a recharge. A recharge of R MNY units buys R * 1000 / cost_per_1000_units_mny units of discount.
For a cost-based discount where a recharge buys the face value of discount usage, cost_per_1000_units_mny = 1000.
fields.name: cost_per_1000_units_mny

fields.description: The identifier of the lifecycle profile associated to this discount. Enables the lifecycle management at bucket level. This must be populated if discount is lifecycle managed.
fields.name: lc_profile_id

fields.description:
Identifies if the discount is enabled for Sharing. Applicable only for Rating Time discounted usage discounts and Usage counters.
If the discount is a Discounted Usage discount, indicates that this discount is being shared by sub-Limit usage counters. If the discount is a usage counter, indicates that this is a sub-Limit usage counter and it is sharing from a discounted usage discount.
fields.name: shared_discount_boo

fields.description:
Enables recharge of non-monetary rating time discounts, or charging only a proportion of the discountable usage for cost-based rating time discounts.
Must be populated for an event discount specified by a recharge. A recharge of R MNY units buys R * 1000 / cost_per_1000_units_mny units of discount.
For a cost-based discount where a recharge buys the face value of discount usage, cost_per_1000_units_mny = 1000.
fields.name: merge_buckets_boo

fields.description: The identifier of the lifecycle profile associated to this discount. Enables the lifecycle management at bucket level. This must be populated if discount is lifecycle managed.
fields.name: dynamic_discount_boo

fields.description: The identifier of the one-time charge to which this record relates. Optionally populated only for dynamic discounts. If set to 'null' for dynamic discounts, dynamic bucket allocation shall not incur any cost.
fields.name: otc_id

fields.description: Defines the choice of rules for dynamic allocation of buckets, if the discount is dynamic.
fields.name: dynamic_allocation_rule_id

fields.description: Defines the choice of rules for dynamic allocation of buckets, if the discount is dynamic.
fields.name: dynamic_allocation_rule_value

fields.description:
Specifies the maximum number of buckets that could be dynamically allocated within the same discount period.
Valid values range from 0-999.
0 indicates unlimited number of buckets per discount period.
Any value between 1-999 indicates the exact maximum number of buckets that could be allocated per discount period applicable.
This field can be not null only for dynamic discounts with dynamic_allocation_rule 1 and null for all other discounts.
fields.name: max_num_buckets

fields.description: Allied discounts group identifier. Only dynamic discounts are allowed to form an allied group.
fields.name: allied_discounts_group_id

fields.description: Determines whether the allocation cost of dynamic buckets can be charged 'only' to cash discount buckets .If set to False (or null) the allocation cost is charged to account.
fields.name: charge_cash_bundles_boo

fields.description: Specifies whether a billing time post-itemisation discount applicable to event charges should be applied on the net charge or gross charge of the event. The net charge means discounted cost of the event after the application of high priority gross/net discount.
fields.name: net_charge_boo

fields.description: Specifies whether any further billing time post-itemisation discounts can be applied on the event charge after applying this discount.
fields.name: no_further_discounts_boo

fields.description: Specifies whether an event charge can participate in the assessment set of further billing time post-itemisation discounts after participating in the assessment set of this discount.
fields.name: no_further_assessment_boo

fields.description: Specifies the precision for billing time discount, its maximum value could be 6. If it is null then it considered as 2 decimal places and it is the minimum value.
fields.name: discount_pct_granularity

fields.description: Specifies the precision for billing time discount, its maximum value could be 6. If it is null then it considered as 2 decimal places and it is the minimum value.
fields.name: additional_validity_mode

fields.description: Indicates whether the event discount is negotiable or not. If the values is "T", then the discount is negotiable and will allow the user to create the customer specific discount slabs.
fields.name: negotiable_discount_boo

fields.description: Value defines the lower limit for negotiable discount to allow for the customer or account or product in percentage.
fields.name: min_discount_pct

fields.description: Value defines the upper limit for negotiable discount to allow for the customer or account or product in percentage.
fields.name: max_discount_pct

fields.description: Value defines the lower limit for negotiable discount to allow for the customer or account or product in monetary amount.
fields.name: min_discount_mny

fields.description: Value defines the upper limit for negotiable discount to allow for the customer or account or product in monetary amount.
fields.name: max_discount_mny

fields.description:
Defines the threshold in percentage for the shared discounts. Consumers can start looking up this discount consumption once the defined threshold of usage is left in the real time flow. It is applicable only in CUBE deployments.
For PERCENTAGE values, the units are always in multiples of 0.01%. e.g. shrd_lookup_threshold_value = 9000 means 90%.
fields.name: shrd_lookup_threshold_value

fields.description:
Set to 1 or 0 based on whether to, include or exclude reserved quota during notification threshold evaluation by QCM.
By-default it has to be zero for NULL in DB.
fields.name: threshold_assesment_criteria_id

fields.description:
Set to 1 or 0 based on whether to, include or exclude reserved quota during notification threshold evaluation by QCM.
By-default it has to be zero for NULL in DB.
fields.name: threshold_assesment_criteria_value

fields.description: To identify the rating time discount actions set that should be applied to this rating time discount.
fields.name: disc_status_action_set_id

fields.description: Column used as divisor to determine how many units needs to be added/truncated (based upon Discount_Rounding_type value)
fields.name: rounding_unit_size

fields.description: It determines whether to increase or decrease the value while rounding.
fields.name: discount_rounding_type

dim_exceptionalbillconditions.description: Stores system wide parameters to detect abnormal bills, that is, those which suggest an error in the billing process or price plan definition.

fields.description: The currency of these exceptional bill conditions. Can only be set to a Currency that is marked as a pricing currency.
fields.name: currency_code_id

fields.description: The name of currency of these exceptional bill conditions. Can only be set to a Currency that is marked as a pricing currency.
fields.name: currency_value

fields.description: Flag to indicate if exceptional bill conditions apply to pre-pay or post-pay accounts.
fields.name: prepay_boo

fields.description: Indicates if the bill is being requested in realtime.
fields.name: start_dat

fields.description: Indicates if the bill is being requested in realtime.
fields.name: realtime_bill_boo

fields.description: If the bill is less than minimum_bill_mny and greater than max_neg_bill_mny and this attribute is set to T, the Billing Engine will increment Account.next_bill_dtm by one bill period and not mark the account as having generated an exceptional bill.
fields.name: increment_bill_date_boo

fields.description: Any bill in excess of this amount will be flagged as exceptional.
fields.name: maximum_bill_mny

fields.description:
Any bill for an amount less than this amount and greater than max_neg_bill_mny this will be flagged as exceptional or the account bill date incremented - see increment_bill_date_boo.
Many companies would not send a bill for 20 pence as the costs of collection are greater than the revenue to be collected, but want to issue credit notes.
fields.name: minimum_bill_mny

fields.description: Any bill greater than this number of times the account's credit limit will be flagged as exceptional.
fields.name: credit_limit_multiplier

fields.description:
If a bill is less than this amount, it is deemed exceptional.
Note that this field will contain a negative amount, for example -$1000.00.
fields.name: min_neg_bill_mny

fields.description:
If a bill is greater than this amount and less than minimum_bill_mny, it is deemed exceptional.
Note that this field will contain a negative amount, for example -$5.00.
fields.name: max_neg_bill_mny

dim_revenuefeed.description: A revenue feed defines an aggregated view of data that relates to financial activity within Infinys Rating and Billing (such as the product, event and tax charges resulting from a bill, payments made against a bill, etc) and the processes that will produce the data for the feed (a single feed can be produced by one or many processes).

fields.description: Unique identifier for a given revenue feed.
fields.name: revenue_feed_id

fields.description: The name of the revenue feed.
fields.name: revenue_feed_name

fields.description:
Identifies the processes (the revenue feed source) that will output data for the revenue feed.
If a revenue feed is produced by a single feed source then the value of FEED_SOURCE_BITFIELD will be equal to the FEED_SOURCE_BITFLAG value for that feed source.
If a revenue feed is produced by multiple feed sources then the value of FEED_SOURCE_BITFIELD will be equal to the sum of the FEED_SOURCE_BITFLAG values for all of the feed sources that produce the data.
fields.name: feed_source_bitfield

fields.description: The ID of status of the revenue feed. If set to active then data for the revenue feed will be output by the processes identified by FEED_SOURCE_BITFIELD. If set to inactive then no data for the revenue feed will be output.
fields.name: feed_status_id

fields.description: The status of the revenue feed. If set to active then data for the revenue feed will be output by the processes identified by FEED_SOURCE_BITFIELD. If set to inactive then no data for the revenue feed will be output.
fields.name: feed_status_value

fields.description: Indicates for feeds which include invoiced data whether or not the total of one of the summation attributes must match the charges total of the invoice from which the feed was generated. The accounts with payment arrangements will match the invoice total excluding the installment amount.
fields.name: match_invoice_total_boo

fields.description: Indicates if the data produced by system processes for this revenue feed is aggregated and written to the financial journal tables.
fields.name: aggregate_boo

fields.description: Indicates if aggregated revenue feed data must be processed for revenue recognition.
fields.name: revenue_recognised_boo

fields.description: For a revenue feed including one or more of the source classes 'Post-Itemization Discount', 'Banded Discount', 'Aggregate Pricing', the value in this new column determines how the values of revenue_start_dat and revenue_end_dat are derived when writing revenue for these source classes to the BillDetails table. When set to 'T' (true), revenue_start_dat and revenue_end_dat will be set to the values which would be used when writing revenue for the corresponding discounted charges (events, product charges, or one-time charges) to billdetails. When set to 'F' (false), backwards-compatible behaviour is maintained; revenue_start_dat is set to the date value of Account.event_billed_to_dtm if not null and otherwise to the value of the account's go-live date, and revenue_end_dat is set to the date value of the event tidemark for the bill being produced (i.e. to the date value of what Account.event_billed_to_dtm will be set to following successful production of the current bill).
fields.name: discs_inherit_dates_boo

fields.description: Determines whether the feed aggregated revenue should be split according to the accounting periods or not. When set to 'T' (true), revenue_start_dat and revenue_end_dat in BillDetails will be set to the values corresponding to the accounting period under which they fall. When set to 'F' (false), the existing behaviour is maintained ( as per 00005257-IN).
fields.name: accounting_periods_boo

fields.description: For a revenue feed including one or more of the source classes like 'VAT Tax', 'UX Tax On Charge', 'Brazilian Tax', if the accounting_periods_boo is set to T, this determines how the values of revenue_start_dat and revenue_end_dat are derived when writing revenue for these source classes to the BillDetails table. When set to 'T' (true), revenue_start_dat and revenue_end_dat will be set to the values which would be used when writing revenue for the corresponding taxed charges (events, product charges, or one-time charges) to BillDetails. When set to 'F' (false), backwards-compatible behaviour is maintained; the start and end dates of the tax will be set to tax point date.
fields.name: tax_inherit_dates_boo

fields.description: The summation attribute of the feed that provides the actual revenue amount. For payments this is the attribute of the feed that holds the paid amount and for non-payments this is the attribute that holds the cost of the charge. This is required for revenue recognition processing.
fields.name: amount_attr_num

fields.description: The grouping attribute of the feed that identifies the receivable class for the aggregated data. Required for revenue recognition processing if the allocation of cash to revenue needs to be done by receivable class payment priority.
fields.name: receive_class_attr_num

fields.description: TThe grouping attribute of the feed that identifies the revenue recognition class for the aggregated data. Required for revenue recognition processing if revenue needs to be amortized.
fields.name: rev_recog_class_attr_num

fields.description: Description of the revenue feed.
fields.name: revenue_feed_desc

fields.description: Flag indicating if the revenue feed is monthly or not
fields.name: monthly_feed_boo

fields.description: Flag indicating if the revenue feed is meant for Double Entry Accounting feature (A4500) or not.
fields.name: fa_feed_boo

fields.description: BG will consider the corresponding feed for which multiple_bill_estimate_boo is set T and generate bill details as per configured feed.
fields.name: multiple_bill_estimate_boo

fields.name: attribute_number

dim_revenuefeedattributemap.description: Defines which pieces of data should be output for each attribute of the revenue feed. This can vary for each record that is output depending on the source class and source ID.

fields.description: Unique identifier for a revenue feed.

fields.name: attribute_number

fields.description: Identifies the source class the attribute mapping applies to.
fields.name: source_class_id

fields.description:
For a given source class, multiple mappings can be defined based on some attribute of the financial activity, e.g. the PRODUCT_ID, EVENT_TYPE_ID, etc. SOURCE_ID is the value that this attribute must take for the mapping to apply. The attribute the value refers to is defined in REVENUEFEEDSOURCECLASS for the source class.
A NULL value represents a wildcard, i.e. always use this mapping for financial activity with the chosen SOURCE_CLASS_ID regardless of its SOURCE_ID.
fields.name: source_id

fields.description: Controls whether or not data is output to the feed for the specified source class and source identifier. If any one of the attribute mappings used in producing a feed output record has a value of TRUE then no feed data will be output for the combination of source class and source identifier.

fields.description:
Identifies the data the process that is producing the revenue feed date should output for this ATTRIBUTE_NUMBER of the feed. Will be NULL if EXCLUDE_FROM_FEED_BOO is TRUE, and will be NOT NULL if EXCLUDE_FROM_FEED_BOO is FALSE.

fields.description:
Holds the unique external reference that may be used by third party applications to recognize events. The number will be padded with zeros and calculated by taking the ProcessInstanceLog.process_instance_id of the generating volume processing application (e.g. Active Rating Engine or Payment Recharge Server), converting it to hexadecimal (padding with zeros to a length of 7 hexadecimal characters) and concatenating a padded (to a length of 9 hexadecimal characters) event number. This event number is a count (in hexadecimal) of how many events the application has processed in the current session.
If this is populated then it is an indicator that the account payment is a recharge payment.
fields.name: event_id

fields.description: Customer reference of the Customer who owns this Account.
fields.name: customer_ref

fields.description: The account to which this costed event belongs.
fields.name: account_num

fields.description: A sequence number, unique within the account, identifying the invoice to which the totals on this record relate.

fields.description:
The sum of the basic prices of the rated events for this account, for this invoice, for this rate process group.
Incremented by the Active Rating Engine and decremented by maintenance programs such as the Event Unloader and the Duplicate Event Remover.
Note: This figure is not necessarily what the customer will pay for the events, as they are likely to be discounted at bill time.
fields.name: rated_event_mny

fields.description: The number of events rated for this account, invoice, rating process group combination. This may be smaller than costedevent_count if event fragmentation has taken place. Incremented by the Active Rating Engine and decremented by maintenance programs such as the Event Unloader and the Duplicate Event Remover.
fields.name: rated_event_count

fields.description: The number of records in the CostedEvent table for this account, invoice, rating process group combination. This may be larger than rated_event_count if event fragmentation has taken place. Incremented by the Active Rating Engine and decremented by maintenance programs such as the Event Unloader, and the Duplicate Event Remover.
fields.name: costedevent_rec_count

fields.description: The fast_cache_seq of the parent account. This value is denormalized from the ACCOUNT table.
fields.name: fast_cache_seq

fields.description:
Indicates the numeric equivalent of event_seq regardless of the format of the event_seq.
If event_seq is in proper numeric format, event_seq_num will be same as event_seq.
If event_seq is in YYMMDDBBB format, event_seq_num will represent a numeric equivalent value of the event_seq.
fields.name: event_seq_num

fields.description: Indicates a sequential number of the bill cycle of an account using which all records of this table corresponding to a particular bill period/cycle can be identified though there may have been multiple AccountRatingSummary records because of interim bills.
fields.name: bill_period_num

fields.description: The most recent date and time that a rated event occurred for this account, for this invoice, for this rate process group. The date and time is of the event itself and not when it was rated. This does not include events that may have physically occurred but have not yet been rated. This column is not updated when rated events are unloaded and therefore should be treated as a high watermark.
fields.name: latest_rated_event_dtm

fields.description: This specifies the enqueue date and time of the most recent Oracle Streams Advanced Queuing message to contain an event for this account and bill. If the costed event queue is not being used, then this attribute is populated with the last costed event's created_dtm.
fields.name: last_costed_message_dtm

fields.description: The current customer_category of the customer owning this account. Denormalized down from the CUSTOMER table. Used only for Hybrid customers.
fields.name: customer_category

fields.description: The external balance ID of the account. Denormalized from the ACCOUNT table.
fields.name: external_balance_liid

fields.description: The number of anti-events for this account, invoice and rating process group combination. Null means zero.
fields.name: rated_anti_event_count

fields.description: The number of records in the CostedEvent table that are parts of an anti-event, for this account, invoice and rating process group combination. Null means zero.
fields.name: costedevent_anti_rec_count

fields.description: The historic usage value calculated using the threshold source configured for the given policy, for this invoice period.
fields.name: policy_threshold_mny

fields.description: The identifier of the service policy that will be used as the 'bill shock policy' for this account during this invoice period. This policy will have policy_usage_attr_num of -1000 or -1001, and a non-null threshold_source in SERVICEPOLICYCONTROL.
fields.name: policy_id

fields.description: For any pending Real-time One-Time-Charge (OTC) requests that are yet to be created against the account, this field records the accumulated money. Once the real-time OTC is created against the account, the money value of the OTC request AccHasOneTimeCharge.otc_mny is deducted from here and is added to Account.unbilled_realtime_otc_mny.
fields.name: pending_otc_mny

fields.description:
The sum of calculated taxes on the basic prices of the rated events for this account, for this invoice, for this rate process group.
Incremented by the Active Rating Engine and decremented by maintenance programs such as the Event Unloader and the Duplicate Event Remover.
fields.name: rated_event_tax_mny

fields.description: The estimated tax money on pending_otc_mny for real-time periodic charge(RTPC) one-time charges. Once the RTPC one-time-charge(OTC) is created against the account, the tax money value of the OTC request AccHasOneTimeCharge.otc_tax_mny is deducted from here and is added to Account.unbilledD_realtime_otc_mny for only RTPC OTC charges i.e. otc_class = 9.
fields.name: pending_otc_tax_mny

fields.description: The estimated lines tax money for real-time periodic charge(RTPC) one-time charge product for which configured as lines and taxes are expected. Once the RTPC one-time-charge(OTC) is created against the account, the tax money value of the OTC request AccHasOneTimeCharge.rtpc_otc_lines_tax_mny is deducted from here and is added to Account.unbilled_realtime_otc_mny for only RTPC OTC line taxes i.e. otc_class = 9..
fields.name: pending_otc_lines_tax_mny

fields.description: The beginning of the period over which the charge was applied.

fields.name: bill_revenue_feed_seq

fields.description:
It states whether the charge is included in invoice or not.
When TRUE states the charge is a normal charge (the default state).
When FALSE states the charge is included in the total charge of another record.

fct_billproductcharge.description: Stores a history of every product charge generated by the Billing Engine. This table is based on Billproductcharge table from Billing Management system

fields.description: Unique identifier of Customer Account
fields.name: customer_ref

fields.description: Unique identifier of Billing Account
fields.name: account_num

fields.description: Unique identifier of subscriber. Null for charges which can't be allocated to suscriber level
fields.name: subs_id

fields.description: A sequence number, unique within the account that owns this product charge, which links the product charge to the bill on which it has appeared.
fields.name: charge_seq

fields.description: Unique identifier of the product charge within the charge sequence (charge_seq).
fields.name: charge_number

fields.description: The unique sequence number of the bill within the account.
fields.name: bill_seq

fields.description: The nominal date and time of the bill, that is, when it should have been produced.
fields.name: bill_dtm

fields.description: The actual date/time this bill was produced.
fields.name: actual_bill_dtm

fields.description: The sequence number for generations of this bill sequence for this account. This number is incremented by bill cancellations and re-bills for the account and bill sequence.
fields.name: bill_version

fields.description: Specifies the domain of the account which was billed for the product charge.
fields.name: domain_id

fields.description: Unique identifier of Business product instance
fields.name: bpi_id

fields.description: Id of the Product Offering in the Product Offering Catalog (Flat product offering).
fields.name: productoffering_id

fields.description: The product offering name (Flat product offering)
fields.name: productoffering_name

fields.description: ID of the Tariff plan (TLO)
fields.name: tariff_plan_id

fields.description: Tariff plan name (flat product offering name)
fields.name: tariff_plan_name

fields.description: Id of customer category
fields.name: customer_category_id

fields.description: Value of customer category
fields.name: customer_category_value

fields.description: Identifier of the product for this product charge.
fields.name: product_id

fields.description: First day which this product charge record covers.
fields.name: charge_start_dat

fields.description: Last day which this product charge record covers.
fields.name: charge_end_dat

fields.description:
The amount of the product charge in the currency of the account account_num, according to tariff_id and any override prices that have been applied.
Note: If this charge record is for an early termination charge, this is the total amount of the early termination charge, that is, the fixed part plus the multiplier part.
fields.name: charge_cost_mny

fields.description: The type of charge this product charge record represents.
fields.name: charge_type_id

fields.description: The type of charge this product charge record represents.
fields.name: charge_type_value

fields.description: Classifies charges within charge_type. For example, charge_type termination has sub types standard termination and early termination.
fields.name: charge_sub_type_id

fields.description: Charge sub type name.
fields.name: charge_sub_type_value

fields.description: Identifier of the price plan under which this product was billed.
fields.name: tariff_id

fields.description:
Identifier of the revenue code against which the basic cost of this product charge has been recorded (that is, the charge amount prior to any package price and/or override price being applied).
Note: If this charge record is for an early termination charge, this is the revenue code related to the fixed part of the early termination charge, unless the fixed part of the early termination charge is zero, where the revenue code related to the multiplier part of the charge will be used instead (as this is a not null field).
fields.name: revenue_code_id

fields.description: The name of revenue code.
fields.name: revenue_code_value

fields.description: The ID of the CPS under which this product charge was taxed (that is, the cps_id as at the tax point date of the bill).
fields.name: cps_id

fields.description: The value of the CPS under which this product charge was taxed (that is, the cps_id as at the tax point date of the bill).
fields.name: cps_name

fields.description: The ID of the last tax code that acted on the product charge at bill time.
fields.name: taxcode_id

fields.description: The name of this TaxCode.
fields.name: taxcode_value

fields.description: Percentage of the full product charge that this record covers.
fields.name: percentage_pct

fields.description: The quantity of the product which produced this product charge. Usually 1, but may be >1 for parametric products.
fields.name: product_quantity

fields.description: The age of the product (in months). Calculated as the difference between charge_start_dat and start_dat on the earliest CustProductDetails record for the product, then rounded down to a whole month value.
fields.name: product_age

fields.description: Represents the status of the product charge record.
fields.name: bpc_status_id

fields.description: Represents the status of the product charge record.
fields.name: bpc_status_value

fields.description: The date and time when this record was created.
fields.name: created_dtm

fields.description: Represents the date from/to which any future BillProductCharge records, which are derived from this record, should be prorated against (if necessary).
fields.name: anchor_dat

fields.description: The version of the price plan that was used when this charge was created.
fields.name: tariff_version

fields.description: ID to indicate the Receivable that this charge was actually billed to.
fields.name: receivable_class_id

fields.description: Value to indicate the Receivable that this charge was actually billed to.
fields.name: receivable_class_name

fields.description:
Indicates if charge was billed as an in advance or in arrears charge.
T indicates billing in advance.
F indicates billing in arrears.
This allows the correct code or rate change rule to be used when calculating the tax on any charge that needs to be refunded.
fields.name: in_advance_boo

fields.description: For a product allocated to a budget center - sequence number of the budget center for account account_num.
fields.name: budget_centre_seq

fields.description: For a packaged product - sequence number of the package, unique for customer customer_ref.
fields.name: package_seq

fields.description: For a packaged product - identifier of the package for this product charge.
fields.name: package_id

fields.description: For a packaged product - identifies the instance of the product within the package (useful for cases where a product features in a package more than once).
fields.name: product_package_instance

fields.description: The product sequence for the parent product of this product.
fields.name: parent_product_seq

fields.description: For parametric products may be >0 if this record represents an increase in the quantity taken from the previous product charge record for this product.
fields.name: additions_quantity

fields.description: For parametric products may be >0 if this record represents a decrease in the quantity taken from the previous product charge record for this product.
fields.name: terminations_quantity

fields.description: For packaged products - the identifier of the price plan under which the product would have been charged if the product had not been part of this package.
fields.name: package_basic_tariff_id

fields.description: For packaged products, the amount of charge that would have been incurred if the product had not been part of this package, that is, the amount of charge under the basic price plan, or comparison price plan (in the currency of the account account_num).
fields.name: package_basic_cost_mny

fields.description:
For packaged products, the identifier of the revenue code under which the 'package saving' or 'package discount' will be recorded.
('package discount' = (package_basic_cost_mny - pre_override_cost_mny))
Or, if pre_override_cost_mny is null,
(package_basic_cost_mny - charge_cost_mny).
fields.name: package_disc_rev_code_id

fields.description: For products where override prices have applied - the amount the charge would have been if the overrides had not been in place (in the currency of the account account_num).
fields.name: pre_override_cost_mny

fields.description:
For products - where an override price has applied - the identifier of the revenue code under which the 'override difference' will be recorded.
('override difference' = (charge_cost_mny - pre_override_cost_mny)).
fields.name: override_rev_code_id

fields.description:
If this charge record is for an early termination charge, this is the amount of charge (in the currency of the account account_num) for the multiplier part of the early termination charge.
Note: The total amount of the early termination charge is recorded in charge_cost_mny, therefore the early termination fixed amount can be derived by (charge_cost_my - early_term_mult_cost_mny).
This field will be null if the multiplier part of the early termination charge is zero or if a breakout function has been used to calculate the early termination charge.
fields.name: early_term_mult_cost_mny

fields.description:
If this charge record is for an early termination charge, this is the revenue code related to the multiplier part of the early termination charge.
Note: The revenue code associated to the fixed part of the early termination charge is recorded in revenue_code_id.
This field will be null if the multiplier part of the early termination charge is zero, or if a breakout function has been used to calculate the early termination charge.
fields.name: early_term_mult_rev_code_id

fields.description: The contract reference under which this product charge was billed.
fields.name: contract_ref

fields.description: The term of the contract under which this product charge was billed.
fields.name: contract_term

fields.description: The term units of the contract under which this product charge was billed.
fields.name: contract_term_units

fields.description: Product characteristics depending on RBM configuration. (The value of the associated CustProductAttrDetails.attribute_value where CustProductAttrDetails.product_attribute_subid = 1 as at the nominal bill date.)
fields.name: product_attr_1

fields.description: The value of the associated CustProductAttrDetails.attribute_value where CustProductAttrDetails.product_attribute_subid = 2 as at the nominal bill date.
fields.name: product_attr_2

fields.description: The value of the associated CustProductAttrDetails.attribute_value where CustProductAttrDetails.product_attribute_subid = 3 as at the nominal bill date.
fields.name: product_attr_3

fields.description: The value of the associated CustProductAttrDetails.attribute_value where CustProductAttrDetails.product_attribute_subid = 4 as at the nominal bill date.
fields.name: product_attr_4

fields.description: The value of the associated CustProductAttrDetails.attribute_value where CustProductAttrDetails.product_attribute_subid = 5 as at the nominal bill date.
fields.name: product_attr_5

fields.description: The value of the associated CustProductAttrDetails.attribute_value where CustProductAttrDetails.product_attribute_subid = 6 as at the nominal bill date.
fields.name: product_attr_6

fields.description: The value of the override, if one exists, for this charge type and charge sub type. This value will be used (in conjunction with override_mod_type_id) for refunding purposes to check whether the override details have changed.
fields.name: override_number

fields.description: The modifier type of the override value, if one exists, for this charge type and charge sub type. This value will be used (in conjunction with override_number) for refunding purposes to check whether the override details have changed.
fields.name: override_mod_type_id

fields.description: Defines the modification type.
fields.name: override_mod_type_value

fields.description: The age-dependent price that affected the cost of this charge. Always null for non-recurring charges. This field (and all other age-dependent price fields) and override fields will not be non-null at the same time. Both sets can be null (if no ADP or override), or just one set can be null.
fields.name: age_dependent_price_id

fields.description: The period at the start of the age band within the age-dependent price that affected the cost of this charge. Always null for non-recurring charges.
fields.name: adp_from_number

fields.description: The period at the end of the age band within the age-dependent price that affected the cost of this charge. Always null for non-recurring charges.
fields.name: adp_to_number

fields.description: The units in which the adp_from_number and adp_to_number are expressed.
fields.name: adp_period_units

fields.description: The cost of this product charge before being modified by an age-dependent price. Always null for non-recurring charges.
fields.name: pre_adp_cost_mny

fields.description: The revenue code used to record the difference between the pre- and post-age-dependent prices. Always null for non-recurring charges.
fields.name: adp_recur_disc_rev_code_id

fields.description: The cost of this product charge before prorating but after any override or age-dependent price has been applied. Always null for non-recurring charges.
fields.name: full_period_cost_mny

fields.description: If this record is for a charge which covers part of a day, this is the date and time that the charge starts. If this record is for a charge which covers a whole number of days, this field will be null.
fields.name: charge_start_dtm

fields.description: If this record is for a charge which covers part of a day, this is the date and time that the charge ends. If this record is for a charge which covers a whole number of days, this field will be null.
fields.name: charge_end_dtm

fields.description: If this record is for a periodic charge, this is the activation rule from the price plan that was used when this charge was created. A value of null for a periodic charge is equivalent to '1'. For non-periodic charges, this field is always null.
fields.name: activation_rule

fields.description: If this record is for a periodic charge, this is the suspension rule from the price plan that was used when this charge was created. A value of null for a periodic charge is equivalent to '2'. For non-periodic charges, this field is always null.
fields.name: suspension_rule

fields.description: If this record is for a periodic charge, this is the reactivation rule from the price plan that was used when this charge was created. A value of null for a periodic charge is equivalent to '2'. For non-periodic charges, this field is always null.
fields.name: reactivation_rule

fields.description: If this record is for a periodic charge, this is the termination rule from the price plan that was used when this charge was created. A value of null for a periodic charge is equivalent to '2'. For non-periodic charges, this field is always null.
fields.name: termination_rule

fields.description: Revenue recognition class for this product charge.
fields.name: rev_recognition_class_id

fields.description: Indicates the source of the charge. Only relevant for early termination charge i.e., will only be populated for the records of type Early Termination. For all other charge sub types, this will be NULL. This will be NULL for all migrated records irrespective of the charge sub type.
fields.name: charge_source

fields.description: Start date of the contract under which this product charge was billed.
fields.name: contract_start_dat

fields.description: The type of the contract under which this product charge was billed.
fields.name: contract_type_id

fields.description: The percentage of tax corresponding to the tax code that acted on the product charge at bill time. Must be null if tax_rate_mny is set. Must be set if tax_rate_mny is null. It is the same value as TaxCodeDetails.tax_rate_pct.
fields.name: tax_rate_pct

fields.description: The flat rate amount of tax corresponding to the tax code that acted on the product charge at bill time. Must be null if tax_rate_pct is set. Must be set if tax_rate_pct is null. It is the same value as TaxCodeDetails.tax_rate_mny.
fields.name: tax_rate_mny

fields.description: The currency of the flat rate tax. Must be set if and only if tax_rate_mny is set.. It is the same value as TaxCodeDetails.tax_rate_currency_code.
fields.name: tax_rate_currency_code

fields.description: When the product is an Community Group owner product that is charged by the number of members in the Community Group, that number that was calculated during billing will be populated here. Otherwise, this field will be null.
fields.name: cog_member_qty

fields.description: Accumulated points.
fields.name: accumulated_points

fields.description: Stores points redeemed on the charge.
fields.name: redeemed_points

fields.description: Stores the cost before applying the loyalty points.
fields.name: pre_loyalty_cost_mny

fields.description: Price characteristics depending on RBM configuration. (The value of TariffElementAttrDetails.xxx_attr_value for product_price_attr_id = 1 depending on charge type of this record. Here xxx can be one_off/recurring/termination/susp/susp_recur/react/early_term depending on charge type of this record. For example if the record is for Standard recurring charges then the recurring_attr_value will be taken from TariffElementAttrDetails where product_price_attr_id = 1.)

For example if the record is for Standard recurring charges then the recurring_attr_value will be taken from TariffElementAttrDetails where product_price_attr_id = 2.
fields.name: price_attr_2

fields.description: The value of TariffElementAttrDetails.xxx_attr_value for product_price_attr_id = 3 depending on charge type of this record. Here xxx can be one_off/recurring/termination/susp/susp_recur/react/early_term depending on charge type of this record. For example if the record is for Standard recurring charges then the recurring_attr_value will be taken from TariffElementAttrDetails where product_price_attr_id = 3.
fields.name: price_attr_3

fields.description: The value of TariffElementAttrDetails.xxx_attr_value for product_price_attr_id = 4 depending on charge type of this record. Here xxx can be one_off/recurring/termination/susp/susp_recur/react/early_term depending on charge type of this record. For example if the record is for Standard recurring charges then the recurring_attr_value will be taken from TariffElementAttrDetails where product_price_attr_id = 4.
fields.name: price_attr_4

fields.description: The value of TariffElementAttrDetails.xxx_attr_value for product_price_attr_id = 5 depending on charge type of this record. Here xxx can be one_off/recurring/termination/susp/susp_recur/react/early_term depending on charge type of this record. For example if the record is for Standard recurring charges then the recurring_attr_value will be taken from TariffElementAttrDetails where product_price_attr_id = 5.
fields.name: price_attr_5

fields.description: The value of TariffElementAttrDetails.xxx_attr_value for product_price_attr_id = 6 depending on charge type of this record. Here xxx can be one_off/recurring/termination/susp/susp_recur/react/early_term depending on charge type of this record. For example if the record is for Standard recurring charges then the recurring_attr_value will be taken from TariffElementAttrDetails where product_price_attr_id = 6.
fields.name: price_attr_6

fields.description: This field will be populated with configured value from cpcsplitbyamount table when there is amount based splitting of charges and it will be NULL when there is percentage based splitting.
fields.name: split_charge_amount_mny

fields.description:
The Full period cost of this product charge before being modified by split amount(input from CPCsplitByAmount).Always null for non-recurring charges and recurring charges configured with percentage.
For parametric Product: This column holds the zero band threshold value if zero band exists. If zero band is not configured then it holds the highest threshold value of its quantity qualified.
fields.name: pre_split_full_period_cost_mny

fields.description:
Information in to this column will be populated when the split charge by amount functionality is in use. For all other cases, this column will be null.
1. From Catalogue Price Plan
2. From Override Price
3. From ADP Price.
fields.name: split_charge_source

fields.description: Date start of actual charge
fields.name: actual_charge_start_dat

fields.description: End date of actual charge
fields.name: actual_charge_end_dat

fct_billrequest.description: Holds requests for bills. For example, Interim, Adjustment, Termination.

fields.description: The Unique identifier of customer
fields.name: customer_ref

fields.description: The account to which this record refers.
fields.name: account_num

fields.description: Request sequence number, unique within account.
fields.name: request_seq

fields.description: The date on which to produce the bill.
fields.name: bill_dat

fields.description: ID of type of bill this request is for. For example: Interim, Termination.
fields.name: bill_type_id

fields.description: Type of bill this request is for. For example: Interim, Termination.
fields.name: bill_type_value

fields.description: The sequence number of the bill produced as a result of this request. May never be filled in if the request is suppressed, for example, a Periodic bill due at the same time as an Interim request is processed.
fields.name: bill_seq

fields.description:
Id of status of this bill request.
bill_request_status and bill_seq give the complete description of the state of this request.
If bill_request_status = 1 and bill_seq is null then the bill is waiting to be processed.
If bill_request_status = 1 and bill_seq is not null then this record is invalid.
If bill_request_status = 2 and bill_seq is not null then a bill has been produced. It could have been suppressed by another request, in which case the suppressing bill's bill_seq is shown. There is no simple way of telling if a request has been suppressed.
If bill_request_status = 2 and bill_seq is null, then no bill has been produced. This is only valid for credit notes where no credit adjustments were present at the time of the bill request.
Valid values are defined by the BILL_REQ_STATUS domain.
fields.name: bill_request_status_id

fields.description:
Value of status of this bill request.
bill_request_status and bill_seq give the complete description of the state of this request.
If bill_request_status = 1 and bill_seq is null then the bill is waiting to be processed.
If bill_request_status = 1 and bill_seq is not null then this record is invalid.
If bill_request_status = 2 and bill_seq is not null then a bill has been produced. It could have been suppressed by another request, in which case the suppressing bill's bill_seq is shown. There is no simple way of telling if a request has been suppressed.
If bill_request_status = 2 and bill_seq is null, then no bill has been produced. This is only valid for credit notes where no credit adjustments were present at the time of the bill request.
Valid values are defined by the BILL_REQ_STATUS domain.
fields.name: bill_request_status_value

fields.description: Indicates if the bill is to be produced in real time.
fields.name: realtime_boo

fields.description:
Operator defined date, which - if specified, and for non-periodic bill requests - would be used to calculate the appropriate payment due date (i.e. BillSummary.payment_due_dat) for the associated account.
It would be null for near real time periodic bill requests.
fields.name: override_payment_base_dat

fields.description: The actual termination date passed in by the user. When BG picks up accounts based on the bill requests, it will consider Actual_termination_dat to pick the bill request for processing. BG will process the bill request on the date which is the earliest in Actual_termination_dat and Bill_dat.
fields.name: actual_termination_dat

fields.description: This column describes the number of bills that Billing Engine is going to generate in case of multiple billing offers. If it is null, should go as per the existing functionality
fields.name: number_of_bills

fields.description: It indicates Billing Engine to consider the products status as 'OK' which are in 'PE' while producing billing estimates when it is set to TRUE.
fields.name: treat_pe_as_ok_boo

fields.description: The date to be used as currency conversion reference date. The Billing Engine will refer this date to get the currency conversion rates.
fields.name: currency_conversion_ref_dat

fct_billsummary.description: Main table of bill data is based on Billsummary table from Billing Management system

fields.description: Unique identifier of Customer Account
fields.name: customer_ref

fields.description: Unique identifier of Billing Account
fields.name: account_num

fields.description: The unique sequence number of the bill within the account.
fields.name: bill_seq

fields.description: The nominal date and time of the bill, that is, when it should have been produced.
fields.name: bill_dtm

fields.description: The ID of bill type.
fields.name: bill_type_id

fields.description: The value of Bill type
fields.name: bill_type_value

fields.description: The account balance brought forward from the last bill.
fields.name: balance_fwd_mny

fields.description: The amount of money being invoiced, excluding tax.
fields.name: invoice_net_mny

fields.description: The tax owing on the money being invoiced.
fields.name: invoice_tax_mny

fields.description: The total amount of payments that appear on the bill.
fields.name: payments_mny

fields.description: The total amount of failed payments that appear on the bill.
fields.name: failed_payments_mny

fields.description: The total amount of adjustments that appear on the bill.
fields.name: adjustments_mny

fields.description: The total amount of refunds that appear on the bill.
fields.name: refunds_mny

fields.description: The new account balance as a result of this bill.
fields.name: balance_out_mny

fields.description:
Indicates the status of this bill in terms of Electronic Bill Distribution by e-mail.
Will be moved to a bill distribution queue eventually when multiple bills (statements/invoices) are sent out for a single account.
fields.name: ebd_email_status

fields.description: The number of loyalty points brought forward from the last bill.
fields.name: points_fwd

fields.description: The number of loyalty points earned on this bill.
fields.name: points_earned

fields.description: The total of all loyalty point adjustments included on this bill.
fields.name: points_adjusted

fields.description: The number of loyalty points redeemed on this bill.
fields.name: points_redeemed

fields.description:
The loyalty point balance after this bill.
Equal to points_fwd + points_earned - points_redeemed.
fields.name: points_out

fields.description:
The date/time up to which account transactions such as payments, refunds and failed payments have been billed.
Used to ensure all such bill elements are billed once and once only.
fields.name: trans_billed_to_dtm

fields.description:
The date/time up to which costed events have been billed.
Used to ensure all such bill elements are billed once and once only.
fields.name: event_billed_to_dtm

fields.description: The date used as the tax point for this bill.
fields.name: tax_point_dat

fields.description: The total receivables from this bill that was unpaid as at Account.last_debt_analysis_dtm.
fields.name: outstanding_debt_mny

fields.description: The net receivables on this bill as at Account.last_debt_analysis_dtm.
fields.name: chase_debt_mny

fields.description: The receivables from this bill that were in dispute as at Account.last_debt_analysis_dtm.
fields.name: current_dispute_mny

fields.description:
Holds any manual modification to the collections schedule for this bill.
A positive number indicates the customer has been given longer to pay (and thus reduces the effective age of the receivables), while a negative number indicates the opposite.
fields.name: modification_days

fields.name: pre_discounted_cost_mny

fields.name: highest_priority_discount_id

fields.description: A tax override, which may be used in conjunction with a contracted point of supply to determine a tax set used to tax an event. When this field is left blank in an incoming event record, the CPSEventTax table is used to tax the event instead, based on the Event Type.
fields.name: tax_override_id

fields.description: A US tax identifier that is used by the third-party tax package to determine the taxability and tax rate for a charge.
fields.name: ust_category_id

fields.description: A US tax identifier that is used by the third-party tax package to determine the taxability and tax rate for a charge.
fields.name: ust_code_id

fields.description: The account from which this event was re-designated.
fields.name: original_account_num

fields.description: If the event has been re-designated, then this number specifies which rule on the CustEventSource that guided the event.
fields.name: rule_number

fields.description: This references the sequence number of the product that owns the highest priority discount that was used to discount this event.
fields.name: highest_priority_prod_seq

fields.description: The receivable class identifier. Used to assign charges to Bill Receivables.
fields.name: receivable_class_id

fields.description: Name of the receivable class.
fields.name: receivable_class_name

fields.description:
The General Ledger revenue code identifier.
Used in BillDetails to provide detailed revenue breakdown for each bill.
fields.name: revenue_code_id

fields.description: name of revenue code
fields.name: revenue_code_name

fields.description: Holds concatenated discount unloading information for at least 9 rating-time discounts.
fields.name: discount_data

fields.description: This specifies the event reference of the first fragment of the primary MPE if this event is a result of event fragmentation and/or MPE expansion.
fields.name: primary_event_ref

fields.description: T' if this event was rated online, either by a rating engine embedded in an Intelligent Network, or by an Online Charging rating engine. Null or 'F' means that the event was not rated online.
fields.name: inhost_costed_boo

fields.description: If not null, flags the event as a ghost event, and identifies the host event type that was used to guide it. In this case, the associated CustEventSource record will not be found by using the event_type_id; the host_event_type_id must be used instead.
fields.name: host_event_type_id

fields.description: Used to index rating charges, when multiple charges apply to an event.
fields.name: charge_number

fields.description: The post-billing cost for the event, for example, after pre-itemisation discounts. This is null if the system is configured to not store this information, via the ICoParam SYSretainBilledEventCostBoo. Note that if the information is stored, it is accurate only for billed events. A value may be present for unbilled events, but it will not be accurate.
fields.name: billed_cost_mny

fields.description: Identifies the masking rule to be applied to the event when displayed on the bill. A value of zero means that the event will not be masked.
fields.name: mask_bill_rule_id

fields.description: Identifies the masking rule to be applied to the event in the data store after billing. A value of zero means that the event will not be masked.
fields.name: mask_store_rule_id

fields.description: The number of days the event will be retained after billing. A positive value indicates that the event will be deleted without archiving this number of days after billing. A zero value means that the event will be deleted without archiving as soon as possible after billing. A null value indicates that the event will not be deleted until it has been archived.
fields.name: post_bill_retention_days

fields.description: The lifecycle type of the event. Valid values are defined by entries in EventLifecycleType.event_lifecycle_type, normal events may also have a NULL value this is equivalent to 0.
fields.name: event_lifecycle_type

fields.description: The event_ref of the previous event in the rerating chain that created this event.
fields.name: previous_event_ref

fields.description: The event_seq of the previous event in the rerating chain that created this event
fields.name: previous_event_seq

fields.description:
If set to T (true), the billed rerated fragments are identified as twins of the corresponding anti-event fragments. If set to F (false) or NULL, the billed rerated fragments are not identified as twins of the corresponding anti-event fragments.
Would be set to NULL for billed rerated fragments under some cases, for example, for billed rerated events that satisfy either of the following conditions:
- The event source changed from one account to another.
- The product associated with the account is terminated leading to the termination of the associated event sources.
Should be NULL for all the other events whose EVENT_LIFECYCLE_TYPE is not equal to 2 (billed rerated event).
fields.name: twin_event_boo

fields.description: Unique identifier of a sales order in BSS.
fields.name: sales_order_id

fields.description: ID of the bill which is being paid.
fields.name: bill_id

fields.description:
The flag indicates whether a card token will be saved in ZPP after payment processing for future payments.
true - the card will be saved for the customer for future payments (ZPP will store whole card token)
false - the card won't be saved for the customer for future payments (ZPP will store only first 6 digits and last 4 digits of a card token - so far only for BoMA payment gateway)
fields.name: save_card

fields.description:
Requestor identification type provided by a system which triggers transaction.
Must be one of the pre-defined reason codes.
fields.name: requestor_type

fields.description: Unique ID of Individual
fields.name: requestor_individual_id

fields.description: Customer_ref (if applicable) who requested for payment
fields.name: requestor_primary_customer_ref

fields.description:
Recipient identification type.
Must be one of the pre-defined reason codes.
fields.name: recipient_type

fields.description: Date and time of the payment request.
fields.name: requested_at

fields.description: Date and time when the payment processing started.
fields.name: started_at

fields.description: Information about amounts and payment methods used for payment.
fields.name: variables

fields.description: List of key-value tags for any purpose (referencing requests etc).
fields.name: tags

fields.description: Date and time when the payment processing finished.
fields.name: finished_at

fields.description: Date and time of creation of payment request
fields.name: created

fields.description: Date and time of updation of payment request
fields.name: updated

fields.description: Unique identifier of the payment generated by ZPP.
fields.name: payment_id
